intro: Clypea venosa, commonly known as the veined clypea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive veined leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Clypea venosa has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
